thread.title: This 117-Year Old Alehouse Is One Of The Most Nostalgic Destinations In Washington
thread.title_full: This 117-Year Old Alehouse Is One Of The Most Nostalgic Destinations In Washington

author: Andrea Verschuyl
title: This 117-Year Old Alehouse Is One Of The Most Nostalgic Destinations In Washington
text:
This 117-Year Old Alehouse Is One Of The Most Nostalgic Destinations In Washington
Are you craving nostalgia with a side of fries? Check out
The Historic Mint Restaurant & Alehouse. Originally founded in 1906, today this bar and grill serves up finger-licking classics in a cozy atmosphere. Old souls will love the history permeating this unique Enumclaw spot, and foodies will love its menu of American standards done right. Learn more about one of the best pubs in Washington and the sleepy town it’s called home for over 100 years.
Are you looking to indulge in a little nostalgia? Check out
The Historic Mint Restaurant & Alehouse in Enumclaw. Easily one of the best pubs in Washington, this local institution is as packed with history as it is with good food.
You may not know that Enumclaw is considered the gateway to
the Chinook Scenic Byway. This stunning route crosses the Cascade mountain range and draws thousands of road-trippers each year who are eager to take in its unparalleled alpine views. Grab a dinner at The Mint before embarking on this adventure, or after exploring nearby parks like Flaming Geyser, Nolte, Federation Forest, and Kanaskat Palmer.
